comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Douglas AD-5 / A-1E Skyraider 133864 Modex 500 on engine cowling Tail code GD of VAW-33. Wings folded, wheels chocked and securely chained to airfield ramp. Tail of S2F / S-2 ‘STOOF’ Tracker tail code 7V of NAS Glenview ‘RAW-72’ beyond with last part of six digit serial 499 The now former naval air station was located at Glenview, Illinois, a suburb of Chicago. This internet webpage lists several Trackers including Bu No 136499 which matches with the serial code and information gleaned: home.wxs.nl/~roden171/database/136492-136518.htm Possibly S2F-1T / TS-2A Bu No 136499 Constructor Number 408. Seen June 1966 with RAW-72 as 166, also with VT28 as D 407, Retired on 19-10-1978 to the then MASDC as 1S727. May 1990; Scrapped. The Douglas Skyraider served with the US Navy from the 1950s and flew off aircraft carriers both in peace time and combat during the Vietnam War. After retirement from the US Navy many A-1 Skyraiders were acquired by the US Air Force, for service mainly in South East Asia. They were refurbished and modified with tailhook removed, new radio and navigation gear and a YANKEE seat extraction unit installed, plus pneumatic tail wheels. A-1E Skyraider 133864 was transferred to the USAF as 52-133864. While with the 1st Air Commando Squadron of the 14th Air Commando Wing based at Pleiku Air Base, South Vietnam, it was shot down by AAA 45 miles West of Da Nang, South Vietnam on March 12, 1966. The pilot bailed out and was rescued by a helicopter. 1st Air Commando Squadron info and pictures: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1st_Special_Operations_Squadron airwarvietnam.com/1acs.htm www.skyraider.org/skyassn/memberpics/hilliard/hilliard.htm
